thread.title: LeBron James practiced fully Sunday, inching toward playing in Cavaliers' season opener
thread.title_full: LeBron James practiced fully Sunday, inching toward playing in Cavaliers' season opener | cleveland.com

author: Joe Vardon, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: LeBron James practiced fully Sunday, inching toward playing in Cavaliers' season opener
text:
INDEPENDENCE, Ohio â€“ LeBron James practiced fully on Sunday for the first time since receiving an anti-inflammatory injection in his back on Oct. 13, a step toward joining the Cavaliers on the court when the 2015-16 NBA season opens Tuesday in Chicago.
James, who has never missed an opener as he enters his 13 th season, said I "think the real test will be how I feel tomorrow when I get up" as he stopped short of declaring himself a go for Tuesday night.
Cavs coach David Blatt called James' practice "a good sign, a good step," but also said the team wanted to see how its superstar responds after going through his first contact workout in nearly two weeks.
"He did a great job practicing today and hopefully that bodes well for Tuesday," Blatt said.
James referenced a back "injury," but later said the shot and two-week rest period was always planned by the Cavs' medical staff.James last played in a preseason game on Oct. 12 in Columbus and participated in just two of Cleveland's seven practice games.
He missed two weeks last season resting back and knee strains.
"I still got some more rehab to do to continue to get everything stronger get my back right," James said. "But I feel pretty good today."
The last time James and the Cavs visited Chicago's United Center, they closed out the Bulls in Game 6 of an Eastern Conference semifinal.
